p: Little is known about the molecular biology of the family Astroviridae. Like picornaviruses, caliciviruses and hepeviruses, astroviruses possess a non-enveloped capsid and a positive-sense RNA genome. During the replication cycle, they synthesize a subgenomic mRNA species which is necessary for the production of structural proteins. The name is derived from Greek astron ( cσtpov), which means “star”, alluding to the star-like shape of a part of the astrovirus particle (Fig. 14.5).
